data.title: Pretty good food for reasonable price
data.text: All you can eat sushi for only 23 bucks!  It was pretty good, and they had a large variety.  This is a great value for big eaters.  You can also get a pretty nice dinner plate for $19, and from 4:30-9PM most of their sushi is half price.   They also have the option of sitting around the hot plate while the chef throws his knives, cooks in front of you, etc.

data.title: the best, bar none.
data.text: We have eaten at so many sushi spots all over the northern bay area and have been disappointed in every one...but...THIS one!  we love the place and it's become our go-to celebration spot when we are craving sushi.  we just can't go anywhere else.

data.title: Wide variety; taste disappointing
data.text:
We recently visited this restaurant for lunch.  We tried the lunch special, a tonkatsu (pork) ramen. While the soup was tasty, the noodles were slightly overcooked.  One in the party had the lunch bento with chicken teriyaki and declared the chicken tasteless.

Prices are reasonable. Next time, I think I will try the sushi-- they had a variety of special rolls. Will give this restaurant another chance.

data.title: Awesome sushi
data.text: As a sushi chef (and tourist), I'm still pleased to enjoy my meal in this place! There's a wide variety to choose in their menu, and most of them are really creative. The combination of ingredients may sometimes be overwhelming, but in general it makes the dishes unique. Also, they serve appear-to-be-authentic tempura :)

data.title: Sushi
data.text: The sushi was very good but our server didn't know anything about the menu.  That was very frustrating since it was the first time I've eaten there.

data.title: Okay food.
data.text: I ate some yummy sushi and ordered more. After never getting it for what seemed like forever I gave up paid and left. It was a week night  This bad service makes me sure to never go back to this place . The server said they were busy Not really according to the empty tables. Isn't a restaurant supposed to be busy ?

data.title: Our favorite sushi place in Solano County
data.text: This is definitely the best sushi place in Vacaville.  It's a little hole in the wall in downtown Vacaville, but the food is fabulous.  Don't miss the crunch roll (our favorite).  There is an amazing variety on the menu.

data.title: Great Sushi Place!
data.text: We have had dinner at this restaurant a few times now. Both times we were pleasantly surprised. The rolls are large and have lots of flavor. The fish is fresh and delicious.  The staff is very friendly and you can tell this is a local favorite. Not a large fancy place, but the meal will be worth it. We have marked this in our GPS, to be our regular Sushi place. This place beats out the larger place by the freeway. If you can't find parking out front, drive around the corner for more parking.

data.title: Tiny place, perfect sushi
data.text: Great variety of rolls freshly made.  Excellent service.  Hana Sushi has all the traditional favorites plus lots of creative options.  Don't miss the Crunch roll - it's our favorite.

data.title: Good choice
data.text: There are not a lot of sushi places in vacaville and not all I will go to. This place is pretty good. They have tons of rolls to choose from, and I haven't had one that I didn't like. The service can be a bit slow sometimes, but the food makes up for it.

data.title: Delicious fresh sushi
data.text: After trying most of the restaurants in Vacaville, my boyfriend and I have narrowed our favorites down to 2- Napoli Pizzaria and Hana Sushi.  We have been to Hana Sushi many times and done take out from there as well and have not been disappointed.  The sushi is always fresh and delicious and made right there in front of you.  We have not tried their other foods, so I can't speak to them.  The service has been great all but one instance (and it was a new server then).  If you find yourself in Vacaville, this is definitely one to check out.

data.title: Downtown Gem!
data.text: Don't be discouraged by the less-than-appealing door front. Once inside, you'll appreciate it's charm. The food was incredibly tasty and the sushi melted like butta in my mouth! I enjoyed the small but upbeat venue, and especially enjoyed the quality of the food. I am usually hestitant to try to sushi places, but our usual spot had been falling short lately. I'm so glad we took the chance! This is our new downtown favorite. This place is great for all groups: couples, family, friends, business, and even bar seating for solo dining.

data.title: Joe is the BEST!
data.text: I come to Vacaville a few times a year for work. Hana Sushi is one of the first places I go. Love it - Joe is fantastic and a minor legend. :)

data.title: Definitely worth the visit
data.text:
My sushi expert friend told us about this place. We stopped in for lunch and were plesantly surprised, it's a local place that delivers on good sushi and Japanese food. We had a couple of bento box lunches that delivered on tasted on quantity. Don't judge them by their miso soup which is just "okay" (a little bland), they will make up for it with meal and sushi.

CONS
Curb appeal is not great and a little small inside
Street parking can be tight so go around the block

PROS
Fresh sushi & food menu are very good
Be sure to check the board for daily specials
Friendly service

Overall, we're glad to have a local sushi spot in Vacaville that has good quality and a reasonable price.
